title: Sketches beyond the sea /
author: Wilkie, Franc B.
snippet: If the Chicago reader will fancy the floor of the Exposition building given up to cattle, sheep and hogs, and the galleries to implements, and racks of beets and turnips, he will have a very good idea of Agricultural Hall — a building which, during any popular day of one of the animal exhibitions, will be visited by as many as sixty thousand people. It is not so handsome as our building; the lighting is inferior; but as it encloses about four acres, its capacity is rather greater.

title: Sketches beyond the sea /
author: Wilkie, Franc B.
snippet: The morning of the day before the one appointed for the demonstration, I went over to Agricultural Hall to make some inquiries about tickets. It was early in the day, and I found the ticketnoffice not yet open.

title: Sketches beyond the sea /
author: Wilkie, Franc B.
snippet: I may say that the present is the eightieth annual exhibition; that it is held in Agricultural Hall, London, and that Agricultural  Hall is about as large as the Exposition building in Chicago. The show is a sort of a national fete, having reference to Christmas.

title: Sketches beyond the sea /
author: Wilkie, Franc B.
snippet: So much for the right of citizens to assemble to discuss public affairs. Mr. Gladstone and his sympathizers won't meet to-night at Agricultural Hall. The meeting has been " postponed," which means that, owing to threats of terrorism, and rowdyism, its pro- meters dare not attempt to hold it.

title: Sketches beyond the sea /
author: Wilkie, Franc B.
snippet: On Monday I had an opportunity to compare the effect of high breeding by examining it in the thoroughbred men and cattle, and women and sheep and pigs who were gathered face to face at Agricultural Hall. A later day I had an opportunity to compare  the thoroughbred with the common-bred, the vulgar.

title: Rambles in America, past and present.
author: Pairpoint, Alfred J.
snippet: dresses, receptions, and Beethoven Society vocal singing, followed by a grand dance in Armory Hall, with Reeves's full hand in attendance, completed the first day's celebration; and great credit is due to the various joint committees, by their many months' efforts of preparation in thus carrying out the wishes of the community of the district. The banquet  at Agricultural Hall was attended by Vice-President Levi P Morton, Gov. Oliver Ames, and a number of distinguished  guests.

title: Sketches beyond the sea /
author: Wilkie, Franc B.
snippet: Gladstone was at the bottom of it, and he and John Bright were to be the principal speakers. Agricultural Hall, one of the largest buildings for public assemblages  in London, was engaged, and the night appointed. In order to prevent too great a rush, and keep out undesirable people, it was determined to admit the public by use of tickets.

title: Sketches beyond the sea /
author: Wilkie, Franc B.
snippet: shortest method would violate precedent, would throw ianumer- able officials out of office, would not give flunkeys an opportunity  to be insolent, and would greatly accommodate the public. All these reasons probably account for the fact that nearly every man who enters Agricultural Hall must enter a particular hole cut to sit his size, and can enter by no other.
